title: Manchester United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer defends Marcus Rashford following loss at Newcastle
text:
Rashford struggled as United’s centre-forward against Newcastle (Picture: Getty)

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer was unhappy with the service provided to Marcus Rashford after Manchester United suffered a 1-0 defeat to Newcastle.

Matty Longstaff’s strike was the difference between the two sides, as United registered just three shots on target over 90 minutes.

Rashford cut a frustrated player as United’s lone striker up front, but Solskjaer was pleased with the Englishman’s efforts.

‘I was quite pleased to be honest with you,’ Solskjaer said after the game.

The defeat leaves United 12th in the league table (Picture: Getty)

‘He showed hunger to get on the ball and made some very good runs however was unlucky not to receive the ball at times.’

‘It’s disappointing, we started really badly,’ he continued. ‘They are working hard but we couldn’t settle down, we gave too many sloppy balls away.

‘The second half we dominated but did not create enough chances.’

The result leaves United stranded in the bottom half of the Premier League table with just nine points.

United host Liverpool after the international break, but Solskjaer insisted he had zero concerns about his players’ attitude.

Solskjaer has zero concerns about his players’ attitude (Picture: Getty)

‘We are never happy when we don’t win and we are going through a very difficult period, but it’s not too dissimilar a position to where we were last season where I was disappointed with the attitude, but the attitude here is spot on,’ he said.

‘But when you lack six of the starting XI from the first game, of course that will impact on performances.

‘We will work hard to get them back but the lads who are out there gave everything.’
